UPDATE: As of 11:10 a.m., power has been restored at all Concord Community Schools buildings. The cause was an issue at a substation owned by Indiana Michigan Power. Classes will continue as normal. Thank you!

POWER OUTAGE
Shortly after 10:15 a.m. Tuesday, February 18, a power outage was reported at the following Concord Community Schools buildings: Concord High School, Concord Intermediate School, Concord South Side Elementary, Concord Ox Bow Elementary and the Concord Education Center.
East Side, West Side and Concord Junior High School did not lose power and are not affected.
At 10:30 a.m., representatives from Indiana Michigan Power told district leaders that they could be without power for at least an hour. According to the IMP website, a total of 981 customers are currently without power.
Plans are being made to provide lunches at all of the affected buildings. More information will be shared as it becomes available.

PARENTS: Generators are running and we are continuing classes as usual. There is no need to pick up students.

Horizon Education Alliance is at Robert Weed Corporation.
February 14 at 3:10 PM · Bristol, IN ·

This week, engineering students at Concord High School and Northridge High School kicked off a joint Project-Based Learning experience with Robert Weed Corporation in Bristol. Over the next five weeks, students will be working in teams to design new products and systems with an end goal of being chosen to present their ideas to RWC leaders on March 23. To get their minds ready for the task ahead, students started with a tour of the facility, a session about standards and expectations for product design, and an activity that put an advanced manufacturing twist on a child's toy: come up with the most efficient way to put together a Mr. Potato Head.

Good luck to all the young engineers in this project!
